snippet: While decades of demographic changes have cost the Catholic Church much of its political clout in New York, it does have the newly appointed Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan to its credit.
abstract: Catholic Church does not wield as much political power in New York State as it once did, but it has gained an influential new leader in Cardinal Timothy M Dolan.
lead_paragraph: While decades of demographic changes have cost the Catholic Church much of its political clout in New York, it does have the newly appointed Cardinal Timothy M. Dolan to its credit.

headline.seo: The Powers of New York: Catholics
